text: Anson Wood Burchard (April 21, 1865 – January 22, 1927) was an American businessman. He was the vice-chairman of General Electric and the chairman of General Electric International, having served many years as a vice president of General Electric. In addition, he was a director for several public utility companies. Burchard was an associate of AIEE. During WWI, he acted as assistant to Benedict Crowell, who was Director of Munitions. He was the third husband of Allene Tew. He died suddenly at the home of Mortimer L. Schiff. ==References== Category:1927 deaths Category:American chairmen of corporations Category:General Electric people Category:1865 births
title: Anson Wood Burchard
